block.p: Elizabeth Marie Lastique and Lincoln Maccoun Farr were married yesterday at the Park, a restaurant in New York. Bradford Cokelet, an assistant pastor of the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated.

Ms. Lastique, 31, is keeping her name. She is the program director at Creative Arts Workshops for Kids, a nonprofit organization in northern Manhattan. She graduated from Pratt Institute with highest honors.
Elizabeth Marie Lastique and Lincoln Maccoun Farr were married yesterday at the Park, a restaurant in New York. Bradford Cokelet, an assistant pastor of the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated.
Elizabeth Marie Lastique and Lincoln Maccoun Farr were married yesterday at the Park, a restaurant in New York. Bradford Cokelet, an assistant pastor of the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated.

Ms. Lastique, 31, is keeping her name. She is the program director at Creative Arts Workshops for Kids, a nonprofit organization in northern Manhattan. She graduated from Pratt Institute with highest honors.

She is the daughter of Margaret and Conrad Lastique of Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y. Her father, who is retired, worked in Harrison as a computer systems engineer at I.B.M. Her mother, a social worker, is the director of patient and community programs at Hudson River HealthCare, in Peekskill.
Mr. Farr, 33, is an associate producer at David Grubin Productions in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Colby College.
The bridegroom's mother is Roberta Farr of Ocean View, Del. His father, the late David Farr, was a purser in the merchant marine.
